problem_behavior: Pregnant women do not comply with the minimum number of PNCs (four visits)
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women comply with the minimum number of PNCs (four visits)
action: Compliance with the minimum number of PNCs (four visits)

message.English: Dear pregnant women; visit PNC services at least four times as recommended to benefit from preventive and curative care, advice that can help ensure your health and that of your unborn child

problem_behavior: Pregnant women do not respect preventive measures against malaria (IPT/SP and sleeping under the LLIN)
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women apply preventive measures against malaria (IPT/SP and sleep under the LLIN)
action: Implementation of malaria prevention measures (IPT/SP and sleeping under the LLIN)

message.English: Dear pregnant women, sleep every night under the LLIN to avoid malaria which is harmful to your health and that of your baby

problem_behavior: Pregnant women do not have a birth plan
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women develop a birth plan
action: Development of a birth plan

message.English: Pregnant women, discuss your birth plan with your healthcare providers during PNC so that you can receive quality care during your delivery to safeguard your health, your life and the life of your unborn child.

problem_behavior: Pregnant women do not seek help from the HC in time when faced with danger signs
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women are aware of the danger signs of pregnancy and seek help from the HC in time
action: Consultation on the occurrence of a danger sign

message.English: Dear pregnant women, set up your birth plan according to the healthcare providers' guidelines to guarantee your health and that of your unborn child

problem_behavior: Pregnant women delay going to the health center in case of danger signs or childbirth
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women decide in time to seek help from the health center in case of danger signs or childbirth
action: Non-use of indigenous products to speed up labor and delivery; Follow-up of…

message.English: Dear pregnant woman, when you notice any of the following signs: bleeding, pain in the lower abdomen, loss of water, high fever, go immediately to the health center to receive appropriate care.

problem_behavior: Pregnant women use certain indigenous products to speed up labor and delivery
promoted_behavior: Pregnant women do not use indigenous products to speed up labor and delivery
action: Informing the woman of the danger signs during…

message.English: Dear pregnant women, go give birth in a health facility to benefit from assisted childbirth and ensure quality care for yourself and your baby.

problem_behavior: The husband/spouse is not interested in the pregnant woman's health and ignores danger signs
promoted_behavior: The husband/spouse is interested in the pregnant woman's health and knows the danger signs
action: The husband/spouse is involved in the pregnant woman's health and knows the danger signs

message.English: Dear husband/spouse, go with your pregnant wives to the nearest health center, in order to ensure the harmony of the couple, the blossoming of the woman and a healthy development of the pregnancy

problem_behavior: The husband/spouse does not go with the pregnant woman to PNC.
promoted_behavior: The husband/spouse goes with the pregnant woman to PNC
action: Escorting the pregnant woman to the PNC

message.English: Fathers, husbands/spouses, listen carefully: the prenatal consultation allows the pregnant woman to benefit from preventive and curative care, advice on her lifestyle and guarantees her health and that of her unborn child. Thanks to the 4 recommended PNC visits, detection of complications, screening and treatment of infections and other diseases that may occur during pregnancy as well as prevention of transmission of mother-child diseases to ensure good health, harmony of the couple, fulfillment of the woman and a good progress of the pregnancy. In order to reduce the dangers associated with pregnancy and childbirth, pregnant women should follow the following six preventive actions:
1. Tetanus vaccination;
2. HIV testing to protect the baby;
3. Take the indicated dose of iron and folic acid to avoid anemia;
4. Enriching meals, especially during the first 3 months of pregnancy;

problem_behavior: The husband/spouse is slow in deciding to seek help from the HC in case of danger signs or childbirth
promoted_behavior: The husband/spouse decides to seek help from the HC in case of danger signs or childbirth
action: Decision to seek help from the HC in case of danger or delivery signs

message.English: 5. Use iodized salt to prevent spontaneous abortion or premature delivery;

problem_behavior: The husband/spouse is not supportive of the woman for pregnancy follow-up (lack of communication within the couple, abandonment and not taking responsibility, fear of expenses, opposition to covering any costs associated with childbirth, ...)
promoted_behavior: The husband/spouse is supportive of the woman for pregnancy follow-up (communication within the couple, and being aware of one's responsibilities, etc.)
action: Providing support to women for pregnancy follow-up (communication within the couple, being aware of one's responsibilities, etc.)

message.English: 6. Sleep under an impregnated net and take the indicated dose of medication to prevent malaria.

problem_behavior: Encourages prohibited food and the use of indigenous products during pregnancy;
promoted_behavior: Discourages prohibited food and the use of indigenous products during pregnancy;
action: Discouragement of the use of prohibited food and indigenous products during pregnancy;

message.English: Dear community members, immediately escort the pregnant woman to the nearest health center or hospital as soon as you observe any of the following signs: bleeding, convulsions, fever, loss of amniotic fluid, difficult breathing, severe headaches, severe pain in the lower abdomen, swelling of the face, hands or feet, disappearance or reduction of the baby's movements, disturbance of vision for the sake of your own care and that of your unborn child.

problem_behavior: Disregards pregnant women at the PNC.
promoted_behavior: Paying attention to the pregnant woman at the PNC
action: Promoting humanized care

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, give a friendly welcome and humanized care to all pregnant women to encourage them to continue with the use of your services.

problem_behavior: Poor reception of pregnant women at the PNC.
promoted_behavior: Make the pregnant woman feel welcome at the PNC.
action: Discussion and implementation of the delivery plan with the pregnant woman at the PNC.

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, prioritize pregnant women to ensure appropriate emergency care and avoid complications.

problem_behavior: 3/ Does not discuss the delivery plan with pregnant women at the PNC
promoted_behavior: 3/ Discusses delivery plan with pregnant women at the PNC.

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, discuss the birth plan with the pregnant woman during PNC to ensure a safe delivery for the mother and newborn

problem_behavior: Delay in coming to the facility at the first sign of labor
promoted_behavior: Decides to go to the facility on time at the first sign of labor
action: Decision to go to the facility at the first sign of labor

message.English: Dear pregnant women, as soon as one of the signs of labor appears, go immediately to the health facility for a safe delivery in order to receive quality care and guarantee the survival of your baby.

problem_behavior: Refusal to go to the facility for delivery.
promoted_behavior: Agrees to go to the facility for delivery;
action: No use of indigenous products to speed up labor.

message.English: Dear pregnant women, remind the healthcare provider of the contraceptive method you chose during PNC so that you can use it immediately after delivery

problem_behavior: Use of indigenous products to speed up labor;
promoted_behavior: Do not use indigenous products to speed up labor
action: Decision to go to a health facility on time

message.English: Dear pregnant women in labor, avoid the use of inappropriate products not prescribed by the healthcare provider that expose you to delivery complications and death
Dear pregnant women, give birth in a well-equipped maternity hospital with qualified personnel to ensure quality care for you and your baby

problem_behavior: Failure of healthcare provider to refer pregnant women in labor with a complication in time
promoted_behavior: Prompt referral of pregnant women in labor with a complication is done by the healthcare provider
action: Proper monitoring of a woman in labor

message.English: Clinical care providers, take the time to monitor a woman in labor to detect signs of complications in time to ensure proper management
Clinical care providers, prompt referral in case of complications is important to ensure the survival of the pregnant woman and her unborn child.
Clinical care providers, Remember, prompt referral of pregnant women in case of complications is the key to quality care to ensure the survival of the woman and her unborn child

problem_behavior: Women in postpartum do not know the danger signs after delivery.
promoted_behavior: Women in postpartum know the danger signs after delivery.
action: Prompt consultation at the health center in case of any of the danger signs

message.English: WARNING! Dear women, after delivery, go to the nearest health center as soon as you notice any of the following signs (persistent bleeding, convulsion, fever and chills, foul-smelling vaginal discharge, headaches and anemia) to receive appropriate care

problem_behavior: Women in postpartum do not use a contraceptive method before leaving the maternity ward
promoted_behavior: Women in postpartum use a contraceptive method before leaving the maternity ward
action: Use of a contraceptive method before leaving the maternity ward

message.English: WARNING: Dear women, after delivery, use a contraceptive method of your choice after delivery and before leaving the maternity ward to avoid unwanted pregnancies and close pregnancies to ensure your well-being, that of your baby and your family

intervention: Consultation in time for comprehensive abortion care
problem_behavior: Women who carry unwanted pregnancies have clandestine abortions
promoted_behavior: Women with unwanted pregnancies receive comprehensive abortion care in appropriate facilities
action: Consultation in time for comprehensive abortion care

message.English: Dear pregnant women in need of comprehensive abortion care, go to the nearest health center to receive quality care

intervention: Use of comprehensive abortion care services
problem_behavior: Women do not know the danger signs after abortion
promoted_behavior: Women know the danger signs after abortion
action: Use of comprehensive abortion care services

message.English: Dear pregnant women, use a contraceptive method of your choice after abortion to avoid an unwanted pregnancy

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion
problem_behavior: Women do not use contraception after abortion
promoted_behavior: Women choose to use contraception after abortion
action: Using contraception as an option after abortion

message.English: Dear women, use a contraceptive method of your choice after abortion to avoid an unwanted pregnancy and thrive

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion
problem_behavior: The healthcare provider does not give the correct information to women after abortion.
promoted_behavior: Healthcare providers properly inform women about comprehensive abortion care, benefits, possible risks, importance of contraception, etc.
action: Provide women with accurate information about comprehensive abortion care - benefits, possible risks, importance of contraception

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, use safe and secure methods of uterine evacuation in case of abortion to avoid complications and ensure good health of the woman;

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion
problem_behavior: Providers use obsolete uterine evacuation methods (curettage, forced cervical dilation, no pain management, etc.)
promoted_behavior: Healthcare providers use safe methods of uterine evacuation (AMIU, misoprostol, mifepristone, pain management, AINS, para cervical block).
action: Use of safe methods of uterine evacuation (AMIU, misoprostol, mifepristone, pain management, AINS, para cervical block)

message.English: Dear healthcare provider, systematically administer a contraceptive method of choice to every woman who has had an abortion, to prevent pregnancy within six months of the abortion in order to prevent maternal morbidity and mortality

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion
problem_behavior: The community stigmatizes women who perform abortions
promoted_behavior: The community supports women with unwanted pregnancies for comprehensive abortion care
action: Provide the community with correct information on comprehensive abortion care, benefits, possible risks, importance of contraception, etc.

message.English: Dear community members, let's stand up and fight ignorance, misconceptions and fear towards women who have had abortions in order to avoid stigma, discrimination and rejection within the community

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion
problem_behavior: The community is not fully informed about the availability of free comprehensive abortion care services (SCACF)
promoted_behavior: The community is fully informed about the availability of free comprehensive abortion care services (SCACF)
action: Provide correct information about free comprehensive abortion care services

message.English: Dear community members, kindly escort any woman who has had an abortion to the nearest health center to receive quality care.

intervention: Using contraception as an option after abortion

message.English: Dear community members, abortion care services are important and available, for all cases of unsafe abortion go to the health center to receive appropriate care

problem_behavior: Does not provide the newborn with basic care
promoted_behavior: Healthcare provider always provides the newborn with complete basic care
action: Systematic administration of complete basic care to the newborn

message.English: Dear providers, always provide the newborn with complete basic care for good survival

problem_behavior: Does not exclusively breastfeed the baby
promoted_behavior: The mother exclusively breastfeeds the baby;
action: Exclusive breastfeeding

message.English: Dear mothers, exclusively breastfeed your baby after delivery to ensure good health and prevent a close pregnancy
Dear parents, breast milk is the only natural, complete and adapted food for your baby, exclusively breastfeed him from birth until he is six months old

problem_behavior: Do not sleep under the LLIN, leaving the baby exposed to bad weather
promoted_behavior: The mother and the baby sleep under the LLIN.
action: Proper use of the LLIN

message.English: Dear parents, sleeping under Long-lasting Insecticidal Net (LLIN) every night will protect you and your family from bites of mosquitoes that transmit malaria.

problem_behavior: Do not go to the HC as soon as the newborn shows danger signs
promoted_behavior: Protects the baby from bad weather
action: Taking care of the newborn at home (protecting the baby from heat, cold and dressing the baby

message.English: Dear parents, bring your baby immediately to the health center as soon as you detect any of the following infant danger signs: refusal to suck, moving less or being inactive, non-stop crying, fever, breathing difficulties and diarrhea, cough, cold, convulsions...
Dear parents, take good care of the newborn at home, protect the baby against heat, smoke, cold and dress him properly to ensure his healthy growth and avoid illness

Take your baby to the health center immediately if any of the following infant danger signs are detected. The infant is having convulsions, has a distended abdomen or is vomiting whatever he or she swallows, has a foul odor around the navel or the cord is red

Dear parents, as soon as your child is having convulsions, repeated vomiting, refuses to suck or eat, or goes into comma, take him/her immediately to the referral health center or hospital for appropriate care.

target_audience: Sexually active woman of childbearing age, married or not
problem_behavior: Unwanted pregnancies
promoted_behavior: Women of childbearing age use contraception of their choice
action: Use of contraceptive method of choice.

message.English: Dear women of childbearing age, use a contraceptive method of your choice to avoid too many early and late pregnancies to ensure your health and your family well-being

target_audience: Sexually active woman of childbearing age, married or not
problem_behavior: Practice of clandestine abortions 3/ Pregnancies that are too close.
promoted_behavior: Women use contraception of their choice after abortion

message.English: WARNING: Get informed about contraceptive methods from trained providers and health facilities to help you make an informed choice and use a safe and appropriate method * Dear partners, encourage your wives to use the contraceptive methods of their choice for their health and family well-being * Dear women of childbearing age, use a modern contraceptive method of your choice to avoid resorting to unsafe abortions

target_audience: Sexually active woman of childbearing age, married or not

message.English: 1. We should vaccinate our children at birth, 1.5 months, 2.5 months, 3.5 months and 9 months to protect them against tuberculosis, polio, diphtheria, pertussis, hepatitis B, meningitis, pneumonia, yellow fever and measles;

target_audience: Sexually active woman of childbearing age, married or not

message.English: 2. We should respect the 5 free vaccination appointments to guarantee the good health of our children from 0 to 11 months

target_audience: Sexually active woman of childbearing age, married or not

message.English: 3. Have your child vaccinated 5 times before his or her first birthday to protect against vaccine-preventable diseases

problem_behavior: Discontinuation of the method due to side effects or rumors
promoted_behavior: Women with side effects consult a qualified provider before discontinuing the method
action: Timely consultation at the health center in case of side effects that bother the woman

message.English: WARNING: in case of side effects that bother you, go to the health center and immediately consult a trained provider to benefit from the appropriate care

intervention: Use of contraceptive methods in the postpartum period
problem_behavior: The pregnant woman is not adequately informed at the PNC about the importance of using contraceptive methods after delivery.
promoted_behavior: The pregnant woman is adequately informed at the PNC about the importance of using contraceptive methods after delivery.
action: Informing pregnant women about the use of contraceptive methods

message.English: Dear pregnant women, go to the PNC. In addition to monitoring your pregnancy, you will get information and counseling on contraceptive methods to use immediately after delivery. This will allow you to avoid the occurrence of an unwanted pregnancy, ensure good health and family well-being.                                                                         2/ Warning: Ask the provider about contraceptive options to be used immediately after delivery to avoid an early pregnancy and ensure your health, your baby's health and your family's well-being.

intervention: Use of contraceptive methods in the postpartum period

message.English: Dear pregnant women, using a safe and effective contraceptive method after delivery helps you ensure the development and health of the mother-child couple and the well-being of the entire family.

intervention: Use of contraceptive methods in the postpartum period
target_audience: Healthcare provider to women in labor in the latency phase

promoted_behavior: Healthcare provider checks with the woman in labor for information on contraceptive choice

message.English: WARNING: Always check the information on the choice of contraception with the woman in labor so that she can benefit from the chosen method at the PNC if necessary.

intervention: Use of contraceptive methods in the postpartum period
target_audience: Healthcare provider to women in labor in the latency phase
problem_behavior: ealthcare providers do not give contraceptive counseling to women in labor
promoted_behavior: Healthcare provider gives contraceptive counseling to the woman in labor
action: Systematic initiation of contraceptive counseling for women in labor who have not yet chosen a contraceptive method

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, initiate contraceptive counseling with the woman in labor so that she can benefit from a method of her choice for her health, her baby's health and the family's well-being

problem_behavior: Do not denounce the damage suffered
promoted_behavior: 11/ Report any case of violence
action: Reporting all cases of rape

message.English: I, a survivor of SGBV, denounce the abuses I suffered, demand proper care and prosecution of the perpetrator.

problem_behavior: Stigmatizes the victim of sexual violence
promoted_behavior: Stop stigmatizing the victim of sexual violence
action: Promotion of care services for survivors of SGBV victims

message.English: Dear community members, DO NOT stigmatize survivors of SGBV. Encourage them to report and assist them in getting better care.

problem_behavior: Fails to provide timely and appropriate care to the survivor of SGBV.
promoted_behavior: Provides timely and appropriate care to the survivor of SGBV.
action: Holistic care for survivors of SGBV.

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, listen to survivors of SGBV and provide them with adequate care to facilitate their social reintegration

problem_behavior: Harmful and inappropriate practices (non-use of partograms during labor monitoring, Christeller maneuver, ...)
promoted_behavior: Applies recommended practices (use of partograms during labor monitoring, ...)
action: Application of recommended practices to save women's lives (use of partograms during labor monitoring, ...)

message.English: Dear healthcare providers, please follow recommended practices in the management of women in labor. Use partograms during labor monitoring to avoid complications and death of mother and baby

problem_behavior: Fistula patients hide and are ashamed
promoted_behavior: Do not hide, go to the health facility for appropriate care
action: Consultation in health facilities to benefit from fistula repair

message.English: Dear women with urogenital fistulas, come out of hiding to receive proper care and improve your health

problem_behavior: Stigmatization of fistula patients
promoted_behavior: Stop stigmatizing urogenital fistula patients.
action: Assisting patients with urogenital fistulas in the repair process

message.English: Dear community members, DO NOT stigmatize patients with urogenital fistulas, but encourage them to seek medical attention and provide timely support for the repair process so that they can regain their well-being.
